summary: Elegant blues and yellows on black
name: miko
description:
Custom color scheme for 256 color terminals that I've personally used and tuned since I created it in February.  I'm a perfectionist when it comes to this kind of thing, and I've spent a LOT of time fine tuning the colors to be both functional and pleasing to the eye.

Does not currently support the gvim or instances of vim based in a GUI.
install_details:
Place miko.vim in your colors directory at ~/.vim/colors (may be different if using a non-linux platform).  Add the following lines to your ~/.vimrc file to use this colorscheme by default on startup:

:syntax on
:colorscheme miko

versions.release_notes: * Reconciled all shades of yellow to a common, lighter shade.

* Updated #Comment color to a more pleasing, pale red color
* Changed #PreProc colors to a brighter yellow to distinguish from constants, and give function definitions a more distinct apperarance.
* Should be used against a dark gray or black BG.
